cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi WSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the northwest Caribbean, forecast to cross western Cuba Friday, then strengthen rapidly over the central Gulf while tracking toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast – likely between Morgan City and New Orleans

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for the U.S. Gulf Coast as of Advisory #2
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Cayman Islands and portions of western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the Texas-Louisiana border eastward to Alabama/Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible Sunday evening through early Monday; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the core tracks farther west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3–5 ft possible along the Calcasieu Pass and adjacent marshes if the storm’s center makes landfall east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 4–8 inches with isolated higher totals, producing flash-flood potential around Lake Charles.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands Sunday night–Monday.
